turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm getting a really weird charge on my bill this month. It's for $45 and I have no idea where it's coming from. Can someone help me figure this out? I'm so frustrated!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. I can certainly look into that for you. Could you please provide your account number so I can access your billing information?  Also, please be aware that due to security protocols, I may ask for verification of your identity.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, my account number is 1234567890.  But honestly, how can a charge just appear on my bill? And what if it keeps happening? I'm worried this is some kind of scam. Can you explain what the charge is for in plain English, and also what measures are in place to prevent this in the future?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. After reviewing your account, the $45 charge appears to be for an add-on service you subscribed to on the 15th of last month. I see it listed as 'Premium Data Backup'. Regarding preventing future unexpected charges, we offer several options: you can set up billing alerts, review your services online at any time, and enable two-factor authentication for your account. For the 'Premium Data Backup' charge, would you like me to cancel that service for you now, and refund the charge?
